properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-10T16:55:22-00:00

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. A cool airmass combined with clear skies and light winds will result in patchy frost, especially in low lying areas overnight tonight. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-09-10T14:59:53-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-10T00:57:53-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2091820200.2019

properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Near zero visibility in fog is expected or occurring. Dense fog has developed at Sachs Harbour. The fog is expected to dissipate overnight tonight. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Fog advisories are issued when near zero visibilities in fog are expected or occurring. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-10T08:26:19-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-09T16:28:19-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1995988500.2019
Area: Sachs Harbour
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Temperatures reaching 31 degrees Celsius combined with overnight lows near 21 degrees Celsius are expected for the next 2 days. Hot and humid weather returns to Southwestern Ontario. A hot and humid air mass from the Southern United States will move over the region beginning Tuesday and continuing Wednesday. Afternoon temperatures are expected to be in the low thirties both days. Minimum temperatures in the low twenties Tuesday night will provide little relief from the heat. Humidex values in the upper thirties to near 40 are likely for both days. A cold front sliding down from the north will bring this heat event to an end Wednesday night. ### The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-10T18:30:25-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-10T02:31:25-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0957632102.2019
Area: Chatham-Kent - Rondeau Park, Windsor - Leamington - Essex County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. A cool air mass will combine with clearing skies and light winds to make conditions favourable for frost to develop over northwestern New Brunswick tonight. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-10T16:55:22-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-09-10T00:56:22-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1477901812.2019

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Clear skies overnight will allow frost to develop. Temperatures are expected to rebound during the day on Tuesday. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2019-09-10T13:30:01-00:00
